Note: activities that need to require permission still need to be
adapted but utility functions have been added for this purpose to
AppUtils.

jobs: improve job import process

The job activity now displays a list of all tpst files from the
'TopoSuite' directory. A context menu is used to import a job from the
selected tpst. The other action buttons ('export current job', 'clear
current job') have been placed to a new option menu.

Note that this is likely to change in the future as part of a job
management overhaul for the next major version of TopoSuite.

serialization: catch null pointer exception and log (close #836)

This happens when a point is deleted but not the calculations that
actually make use of the point. When deleting a point, one has to make
sure to delete every related calculations as well (see #833 about this).

points: refresh points list on errors during import (close #837)

points: use file ext then fallback to mime for type detection (fix #838)

Detection via mime type is VERY unreliable on Android since file
managers tend to mess with them. Hence this is best to first rely on the
file extension and fallback to the mime type if there is none.

Hence, it is appropriate to call the static delete job method when
deleting all points.

points: use cache dir for share action (close #841)

We previously created a temporary file on external storage when sharing
a file of points was needed. This is bad practice. Moreover, there is no
need to get write permission for sharing a file. Instead, we can simply
use internal storage and give temporary read permission when sharing via
intent. Hence, this is also safer.

As a consequence, I also decided to remove the default 'tmp dir' set in
App. This is not needed anymore. By doing so, we avoid a lot of
problems, notably on Android 6.0+ where it is required to ask for
permission to write to external storage.

calculation: rework the way DAO is done for all calculations (fix #860)

This has a lot of implications so it has to be tested with care.

One known issue is that if a calculation from the history is modified,
it is updated instead of creating a new one (it should since values have
changed).

points: make Point object serializable

make a few classes serializable

This will be useful to be able to serialize calculations.

make 'Calculation.recordToHistory()' private

This method has no reason to be public. We actually need to serialize
calculations via bundle to pass them to other activities. Using the
history for this purpose is PLAIN WRONG, dammit!
Hence, adapt orthogonal survey and axis implantation calculation to use
bundle to serialize calculation to pass it to the result activity. Of
course, this requires the calculation to be plainly serializable.

shared res: compare calculations by ID only

If the id is the same, it shall be considered the same calculation.
calculation: only call notifyUpdate() if the calculation has DAO

fix history issue for calculations

Comparing only calculation ID is wrong. Also, we want to make sure that
the calculation id is <= 0, meaning that the calculation is NOT already
in the history, before inserting it to the history list.

viewutils: fix restoring locking/unlocking orientation (close #877)

If we restore 'full sensors', then it will rotate regardless of the
global user's preference on Android, which is bad. Hence, use user's
preference instead. While here, use new constant to lock orientation for
API 18+ devices instead of a trick to lock to orientation to whatever it
was.
